evs.data.fileio.ohdfile.data
Class DataTable

java.lang.Object
  evs.data.fileio.ohdfile.data.DataTable

public class DataTable
extends java.lang.Object

This class wraps around a table of data. It provides raw methods to access rows, columns, etc. It does no checking of parameters, however, so the calling methods must know the size of the table and pass in valid rows and columns, or an array exception may occur.

Author:
hank herr

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

DataTable

public DataTable(int numberOfRows,
                 int numberOfColumns)
Basic constructor creates the data using the row and column dimensions passed in. The row dimension is the FIRST dimension, column is second... i.e. _data[row][column].

Parameters:
numberOfRows - The number of rows.
numberOfColumns - The number of columns.

setValue

public void setValue(int row,
                     int column,
                     double value)
Sets a value within the data table at the specified row and column, without doing any checks.

Parameters:
row - Index of row
column - Index of column
value - The value to set it to.

getValue

public double getValue(int row,
                       int column)
Gets the value within the passed in cell.

Parameters:
row - Index of row
column - Index of column

setRow

public void setRow(int row,
                   double[] rowArray)
Sets the passed in row to be the given row array. IMPORTANT: The setting is a literal '=' operation, so the passed in row is not a physical copy of the given row array, but is the actual row array. This does no checking to make sure the passed in rowArray is of the right size! It should be the same size as all other rows.

Parameters:
row - Index of rows.
rowArray - array of doubles comprising the row.

getRow

public double[] getRow(int row)
Get the row, itself, not a copy.

public void setRowAsCopy(int row,
                         double[] rowArray)
Sets the passed in row as a copy of the given rowArray.

Parameters:
row - Index of rows.
rowArray - array of doubles comprising the row.

setAllValues

Sets all the values of the double array to the passed in number.

addRow

public void addRow(double nV)
Adds a row to the _data table. The row is made new, and is not initialized, meaning it picks up the default Java initialization of DataSet.MISSING.

Parameters:
nV - the null value

addColumn

public void addColumn(double nV)
Adds a column to the _data table by increasing the size of each row by 1. The new value will be set to the null value.

Parameters:
nV - the null value

removeRow

public void removeRow(int index)
Removes the row pointed to by index.

removeColumn

public void removeColumn(int index)
Removes the column pointed to by index. This is less memory efficient that removeRow.

copyContentsFromDataTable

public void copyContentsFromDataTable(DataTable otherTable,
                                      double nV)
Copy the contents of the passed in DataTable to this DataTable. This is a copy!!! It will attempt to do a cell by cell copy. If a cell in this table is found to be invalid in the other table, then that cell will be set to MISSING. DataTable otherTable The table to copy from.

Parameters:
nV - the null value

createAllMissingArray

public static double[] createAllMissingArray(int quantity,
                                             double nV)
Return an array of all MISSING values of the length passed in.

Parameters:
nV - the null value

copyArray

public static double[] copyArray(double[] array)
Creates a physical copy of the passed in array and returns it.

Parameters:
array - an array
Returns:
a double array

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
MAIN unit test.

Parameters:
args -
